name: wiki_search
description: Guide to searching the Second Life LSL Wiki for keyword-specific information using a standardized URL syntax, ensuring LSL-specific content

details.purpose: To enable AI to efficiently locate detailed LSL documentation by constructing wiki URLs for specific keywords, avoiding SLua content

search_mechanics.description: The Second Life LSL Wiki can be searched using the URL syntax 'https://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/<keyword>', where '<keyword>' is the exact name of an LSL keyword (e.g., function, event, type, constant). If the page is not found, try 'https://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/LSL_<keyword>'. Keywords are case-sensitive and must match the wiki page name precisely. Ensure the page pertains to LSL and not SLua, as SLua uses Lua-based scripting and is unrelated to this primer
search_mechanics.recommendation: Use the LSL Portal as a starting point to identify valid keywords, then construct URLs for specific documentation

best_practices: Use exact, case-sensitive keyword names to ensure valid URLs
If a page is not found, prepend 'LSL_' to the keyword and retry (e.g., 'LSL_integer' if 'integer' fails)
Verify the page content is about LSL, not SLua, by checking for Lua-specific references
Confirm the keyword corresponds to an LSL feature (e.g., 'llSay', 'state_entry', 'integer')
Start with the LSL Portal to browse categories if the keyword is unknown
Test constructed URLs to confirm the wiki page exists

examples.description: Wiki URL for the 'integer' type with 'LSL_' prefix
examples.context: Accesses documentation for the 'integer' data type, using 'LSL_' prefix as a fallback
